intro: Porlieria steinbachii, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its foliage consists of large, heart-shaped leaves with a rough texture.
